results.definition: a device designed to prevent injury or accidents
the duty of serving as a sentry
examples: he was on guard that night

results.definition: a precautionary measure warding off impending danger or damage or injury etc.
examples: an insurance policy is a good safeguard

results.definition: watch over or shield from danger or harm; protect
examples: guard my possessions while I'm away

results.definition: protect against a challenge or attack
(American football) a position on the line of scrimmage
a military unit serving to protect some place or person
a person who keeps watch over something or someone
a position on a basketball team
a posture of defence in boxing or fencing
take precautions in order to avoid some unwanted consequence
examples: guard against becoming too friendly with the staff

results.definition: the person who plays that position on a football team
examples: the left guard was injured on the play

results.definition: the person who plays the position of guard on a basketball team

examples: there would be men guarding the horses
